name: Beaches Jazz Festival
description:
Celebrating its 37th year, the Beaches International Jazz Festival is a month-long music festival held each year in the lakeside Beaches community of Toronto. It's now one of Canada's largest jazz festivals with nearly 1,000,000 attendees, throughout its month-long span.

The Festival takes place across a number of venues; stage concerts are held in several different parks within the area and also along a two kilometre stretch of the Beach mainstreet during StreetFest - Queen Street East.

name: Taste of the Middle East Toronto Festival 2025
description:
Now in its 8th year, this is a vibrant three-day celebration of Arabic music, food, art, and culture. 

Held in the heart of downtown Toronto, we’re proud to welcome over 90,000 visitors to experience over a hundred vendors featuring delicious cuisine, handmade goods, cultural exhibits, and live performances including music, dance, and artistic showcases. We provide a welcoming and inclusive environment supported by over fifty dedicated volunteers.

name: Ink the 6ix Toronto Tattoo Expo
description:
Canada’s tattoo scene gets a bold new addition this summer! Come to this high-energy, three-day celebration of tattoo art and culture. Over 200 global tattoo artists, live tattooing, music, art showcases, vendors, contests, and more. Founded by industry veterans Luis and Tina Puedmag, this event brings together the tattoo community like never before. 

At its heart - Canada’s largest tattoo competition with a $10,000 “Best of Show” prize and title belt for the “Baddest MF Tattoo Artist”. Family-friendly and open to all. 

Please see website for event details.

name: Thursday Night Cuban Jazz Dinner with CaboCubaJazz
description: In an inimitable way, the international ensemble blends the melancholy of the Cape Verdean Islands with a generous portion of Cuban rumba, salsa and adventurous jazz. Both the listener and the dancer are taken on a journey where desire, passion, subtlety and musical fire alternate. CaboCubaJazz has performed in Cuba, Cape Verde, Canada, Thailand, Germany, Finland, Austria, Belgium, Bahrain, Malaysia, Romenia, Luxembourg, Norway and in The Netherlands.

name: Thursday Late Night Jazz with PS5
description:
Sunfest at DROM Taberna! 

PS5 is led by Pietro Santangelo who was born, lives and plays in Naples. As a saxophonist and composer, he released five albums with Slivovitz, one with his PS3 trio. He is a former member of Nu Guinea, Nuova Napoli Band and is involved and engaged in the Italian scene of radical improvisation. The compositions are inspired by the idea of natural biodiversity as an expression of contamination, coexistence and balance. Multiculturalism becomes coexistence. Suggestive saxophone textures intertwine on a solid rhythmic equilibrium and move naturally along an imaginary line highlighting the ancestral connection between Africa and the Mediterranean Sea.

name: Taste of Lawrence 2025

location.name: Lawrence Ave E between Warden Ave and Birchmount Rd

description: Scarborough’s biggest street party, has returned with non-stop entertainment, delicious food, and family-friendly fun.

name: Get On My Level: Forever
description: Canada's largest esports event taking place in the heart of downtown Toronto. Purchase your ticket to either compete or spectate in numerous fighting game tournaments as the best players from across the world will be in attendance to try to become this year's champion. Registration and additional event info is available on our website.

name: Fun Philippines Toronto Food and Music Festival
description: Showcasing the best of Filipino culture highlighting its colourful cuisine, music and dance, arts and crafts, and world class entertainment celebrated with warmth and hospitality. Visitors will savor the vibrant flavors at lively food booths. Indulge in delectable dishes like adobo, pancit, lumpia, and halo-halo. Get ready to satisfy your taste buds and immerse yourself in gastronomic delights!  Experience the Philippines, the pearl of the orient seas.
